intro: Bothriocline inyangana, commonly known as the Natal daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow disc flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Bothriocline inyangana is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
